newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso firms on foreign investor inflow.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso firms on foreign investor inflow.

text.p: The Mexican peso extended early firmness at mid-morning Friday on continuing entry of U.S. investors into the Mexican financial markets, traders said.
"U.S. investors are switching a lot of dollars into pesos," a dealer said. "It's a real inflow from brokers looking for places to invest."
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart stood 1.8 and one centavo firmer, respectively, at 7.8420/7.8450 and 7.8350/7.8390 per dollar.
Same-day contracts closed 2.45 centavos firmer at 7.8220/7.8250 per dollar.
Traders said the peso could relinquish early strength as the Mexican bourse had reversed early gains and U.S. long-bond rates were inching back up.
